intro: Meibomia batocaulon, commonly known as the narrow-leaved meibomia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with four petals and five stamens. Meibomia batocaulon is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
